page.title: 15CONSTANTINE ECOLOGY
page.content: FLOWERS.The early spring hedgerows are full of famous Cornish violets and primroses.They are followed after Easter by bluebells and campians in the woods and by the roadside, interspersed with cow parsley.There's much gorse on the tops of the Cornish stone hedges,and heather on granite areas and moorland.Many wild fuchsia hedges thrive in the warm coastal climate. BIRDS.There are many water birds near our coast,and a variety of gulls which often fly inland. There are wading birds around the Helford River,and Herons and Moorhens are sometimes seen in this district.In the moorland areas Buzzards are often seen,and Pheasants abound in the shooting season.Many Sparrows, Thrushes,Blackbirds and species of Tits and Finches visit the gardens,and Magpies are often seen in the school.
